00133 // Inlines
00134 
00135 inline void Vector::construct(Int d, Real v, Implementation impl) throw(std::invalid_argument)
00136 {
00137 #ifdef DEBUG
00138   if (d==0) throw std::invalid_argument(Exception("Can't construct a Vector of 0 dimension (debug only check)"));
00139 #endif
00140   switch (impl) {
00141   case Standard:
00142   default: this->v = ref<VectorImpl>(NewNamedObj("ValArrayVectorImpl") ValArrayVectorImpl(d,v)); break;
00143   }
00144 }
00145 
00146 inline void Vector::construct(const VectorImpl& v, Implementation impl) throw(std::invalid_argument)
00147 {
00148   switch (impl) {
00149   case Standard:
00150   default: this->v = ref<VectorImpl>(NewNamedObj("ValArrayVectorImpl") ValArrayVectorImpl(v)); break;
00151   }
00152 }
00153 
00154 inline void Vector::construct(Real array[], Int d, Implementation impl) throw(std::invalid_argument)
00155 {
00156   switch (impl) {
00157   case Standard:
00158   default: this->v = ref<VectorImpl>(NewNamedObj("ValArrayVectorImpl") ValArrayVectorImpl(array,d)); break;
00159   }
00160 }
00161 
00162 
00163 inline Vector::Vector(Int d, Real v, Implementation impl)
00164 { construct(d,v,impl); }
00165 
00166 
00167 inline Vector::Vector(const Vector& v)
00168 { construct(*v.v,v.implementation()); }
00169 
00170 inline Vector::Vector(const Vector& v, Implementation impl)
00171 { construct(*v.v,impl); }
00172 
00173 inline Vector::Vector(const Vector3& v)
00174 { construct(3,0,Standard); *this = v; }
00175 
00176 inline Vector::Vector(const Vector4& v)
00177 { construct(4,0,Standard); *this = v; }
00178 
00179 inline Vector::Vector(Real array[], Int d, Implementation impl)
00180 { construct(array,d,impl); }

00182 inline Vector::~Vector()
00183 {}

00185 
00186 inline Vector Vector::zero(Int d = 0) const
00187 { if (d==0) return Vector(dimension()); else return Vector(d); }
00188  
00189 inline bool Vector::inRange(Int d) const
00190 { return ((d>=1) && (d <= v->dim())); }
00191  
00192 inline void Vector::setZero() throw()
00193 { v->setZero(); }
00194 
00195 inline void Vector::resize(Int d) throw(std::invalid_argument)
00196 {
00197   if (d==0) throw std::invalid_argument(Exception("Can't resize a Vector to 0 dimension (debug only check)"));
00198 
00199   // not all implementations support resizing directly
00200   try {
00201     v->resize(d);
00202   } catch (std::runtime_error&) {
00203     Vector newvec(d);
00204     for(Int i=1; i<=base::minimum(dimension(),d); i++)
00205       newvec.e(i) = e(i);
00206     *this = newvec;
00207   }
00208 }
00209 
00210 
00211 inline void Vector::swap(Vector& v)
00212 {
00213   // not all implementations support swapping
00214   try {
00215     this->v->swap(*v.v);
00216   } catch (std::runtime_error&) {
00217     Vector tmp(v);
00218     v = *this;
00219     *this = tmp;
00220   }
00221 }
00222

00224 inline Real& Vector::e(Int i) throw()
00225 { 
00226 #ifdef DEBUG
00227   if (!inRange(i))
00228     throw std::runtime_error(Exception("Vector index out of bounds (debug only check)"));
00229 #endif 
00230   return v->e(i); 
00231 }
00232 
00233 inline const Real& Vector::e(Int i) const throw()
00234 { 
00235 #ifdef DEBUG
00236   if (!inRange(i))
00237     throw std::runtime_error(Exception("Vector index out of bounds (debug only check)"));
00238 #endif 
00239   return v->e(i); 
00240 }

00242 inline Real& Vector::at(Int i) throw(std::out_of_range)
00243 {
00244   if (!inRange(i))
00245     throw std::out_of_range(Exception("Vector index out of bounds"));
00246   return v->e(i);
00247 }
00248 
00249 inline const Real& Vector::at(Int i) const throw(std::out_of_range)
00250 {
00251   if (!inRange(i))
00252     throw std::out_of_range(Exception("Vector index out of bounds"));
00253   return v->e(i);
00254 }

00257 inline Real& Vector::operator[](Int i)
00258 { return e(i); }
00259 inline const Real& Vector::operator[](Int i) const
00260 { return e(i); }
00261 
00262 inline Vector& Vector::operator=(const Vector& src) throw()
00263 { *v = *src.v; return *this; }
00264 
00265 inline Vector& Vector::operator=(Real src) throw()
00266 { *v = src; return *this; }
00267 
00268 inline Vector& Vector::operator=(const Vector3& v) throw()
00269 { this->v->destructiveResize(3); e(1) = v.x; e(2) = v.y; e(3) = v.z; return *this; }
00270 
00271 inline Vector& Vector::operator=(const Vector4& v) throw()
00272 { this->v->destructiveResize(4); e(1) = v.x; e(2) = v.y; e(3) = v.z; e(4) = v.w; return *this; }
00273 
00274 inline bool Vector::operator==(const Vector& v) const throw(std::invalid_argument)
00275 {
00276   if (this == &v) return true;
00277   if (dimension() != v.dimension()) 
00278     throw std::invalid_argument(Exception("can't compare Vectors of different dimensions"));
00279   return ((*this->v) == *v.v); 
00280 }
00281 
00282 inline bool Vector::operator!=(const Vector& v) const throw(std::invalid_argument)
00283 { return !operator==(v); }
00284 
00285 inline bool Vector::equals(const Vector& v, Real epsilon = base::epsilon) const throw(std::invalid_argument)
00286 {   
00287   if (this == &v) return true;
00288   if (dimension() != v.dimension()) 
00289     throw std::invalid_argument(Exception("can't compare Vectors of different dimensions"));
00290   return this->v->equals(*v.v, epsilon); 
00291 }
00292 
00293 
00294 inline Int Vector::dimension() const throw()
00295 { return v->dim(); }
00296 
00297 inline Real Vector::norm() const throw()
00298 {
00299   Real sum=0;
00300   for (Int i=1; i<=dimension(); i++)
00301     sum += base::sqr(e(i));
00302   return sum;
00303 }
00304 
00305 inline Real Vector::magnitude() const throw()
00306 { return sqrt(norm()); }
00307 
00308 inline Real Vector::length() const throw()
00309 { return magnitude(); }
00310 
00311 
00312 inline Vector& Vector::negate() throw() 
00313 { v->negate(); return *this; }
00314 
00315 inline Real Vector::dot(const Vector& p) const throw(std::invalid_argument)
00316 {
00317   if (p.dimension() != dimension())
00318     throw std::invalid_argument(Exception("Can't dot product Vectors of unequal dimension"));
00319   return v->dot(*p.v); 
00320 }
00321 
00322 
00323 inline Vector& Vector::operator+=(const Vector& v2) throw(std::invalid_argument)
00324 { 
00325   if (v2.dimension() != dimension())
00326     throw std::invalid_argument(Exception("Can't add product Vectors of unequal dimension"));
00327   v->operator+=(*v2.v); 
00328   return *this; 
00329 }
00330 
00331 inline Vector& Vector::operator-=(const Vector& v2) throw(std::invalid_argument)
00332 {
00333   if (v2.dimension() != dimension())
00334     throw std::invalid_argument(Exception("Can't subtract product Vectors of unequal dimension"));
00335   v->operator-=(*v2.v); 
00336   return *this; 
00337 }
00338 
00339 inline Vector& Vector::operator*=(const Real& s) throw()
00340 { 
00341   v->operator*=(s); 
00342   return *this;
00343  }
00344 
00345 inline Vector& Vector::operator/=(const Real& s) throw(std::invalid_argument)
00346 { 
00347   if (s==0)
00348     throw std::invalid_argument(Exception("Can't divide by 0")); 
00349   v->operator/=(s); 
00350   return *this; 
00351 }

00359   SliceVectorImpl& sv = *new SliceVectorImpl(*v,start,length,stride);

00364 inline ref<const Vector> Vector::slice(Int start, Int length, Int stride) const throw(std::out_of_range)

00366   if ((start < 1) || (start+length*stride > dimension()))
00367     throw std::out_of_range(Exception("the range of the slice must be contained within the Vector"));
00368 
00369   SliceVectorImpl& sv = *new SliceVectorImpl(const_cast<VectorImpl&>(*v),start,length,stride);
00370   ref<const Vector> v = new Vector(sv,Slice);

00387 inline Vector operator+(const Vector& v1, const Vector& v2) throw() // Addition
00388 { Vector r(v1); return r+=v2; }
00389 
00390 inline Vector operator-(const Vector& v1, const Vector& v2) throw() // Subtraction
00391 { Vector r(v1); return r-=v2; }

00393 inline Vector operator-(const Vector& v1) throw() // Negation
00394 { Vector r(v1); return r.negate(); }

00396 inline Vector operator*(const Vector& v1, const Real& s) throw() // Scalar multiplication
00397 { Vector r(v1); return r*=s; }
00398 
00399 inline Vector operator*(const Real& s, const Vector& v1) throw() // Scalar multiplication
00400 { Vector r(v1); return r*=s; }
00401 
00402 inline Vector operator/(const Vector& v1, const Real& s) // Scalar division
00403 { Vector r(v1); return r/= s; }
00404 
00405 inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const Vector& v) // Output
00406 {
00407   out << "(";
00408   for(Int i=1; i<=v.dimension(); i++) {
00409     out << v[i];
00410     if (i!=v.dimension()) out << ",";
00411   }
00412   out << ")";
00413   return out;
00414 }
00415 
00416 inline Real dot(const Vector& v1, const Vector& v2) throw() // dot product v1.v2
00417 { Vector r(v1); return r.dot(v2); }
00418 
00419 inline Real operator*(const Vector& v1, const Vector& v2) // dot procuct v1.v2
00420 { return dot(v1,v2); }
